intro: Lopezia tepicana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and herbs. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Lopezia tepicana is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing along rocky slopes and in disturbed soils.
